intro: Mollugo debilis, commonly known as the weak bladderwort, is a small, flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy soils, often near coastal areas. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. It is characterized by its rapid growth and ability to thrive in saline environments. Due to its delicate appearance and limited distribution, it is sometimes considered a rare or endangered species in certain regions.
